text: IntelliJ IDEA – the Leading Java and Kotlin IDE, by JetBrains ReleasesIntelliJ IDEA 2024.3.3 Is Out!  We’ve just released IntelliJ IDEA 2024.3.3 with several valuable fixes.  You can update to this version from inside the IDE, by using the Toolbox App, or by using snaps if you are a Ubuntu user. You can also download it from our website. Here are the most important fixes delivered in v2024.3.3: The Reload All Maven Projects action now correctly syncs dependencies. [IDEA-358024] Screen reader detection now works on the first startup on Windows. [IJPL-173992] Custom toolbar icons for external tools are now properly displayed after an IDE restart. [IJPL-172075] The IDE no longer hangs on the Configuring SDK step when adding an IntelliJ Platform Plugin SDK. [IJPL-155995] Resolving merge conflicts using the Conflicts tool window is now possible again. [IJPL-161715] A list of active Kafka producers and consumers is available via Recent Files. [IJPL-154110]  For a complete list of issues addressed in this update, please refer to the release notes. Please report any bugs you encounter using our issue tracker. Happy developing! html:
IntelliJ IDEA – the Leading Java and Kotlin IDE, by JetBrains

Releases

IntelliJ IDEA 2024.3.3 Is Out! 

We’ve just released IntelliJ IDEA 2024.3.3 with several valuable fixes. 

You can update to this version from inside the IDE, by using the Toolbox App, or by using snaps if you are a Ubuntu user. You can also download it from our website.

Here are the most important fixes delivered in v2024.3.3:

  • The Reload All Maven Projects action now correctly syncs dependencies. [IDEA-358024]
  • Screen reader detection now works on the first startup on Windows. [IJPL-173992]
  • Custom toolbar icons for external tools are now properly displayed after an IDE restart. [IJPL-172075]
  • The IDE no longer hangs on the Configuring SDK step when adding an IntelliJ Platform Plugin SDK. [IJPL-155995]
  • Resolving merge conflicts using the Conflicts tool window is now possible again. [IJPL-161715]
  • A list of active Kafka producers and consumers is available via Recent Files. [IJPL-154110] 

For a complete list of issues addressed in this update, please refer to the release notes.

Please report any bugs you encounter using our issue tracker.

Happy developing!
